title: Pound Near 3-Week Lows As GDP Drop Confirmed
text:
As was widely expected the with a decline of 0.2% seen in quarter-on-quarter terms. As is often the case Brexit developments had a clear impact here, with the delaying of the original departure date from March 31st meaning that 1st quarter activity was artificially boosted due to provisions for the break and therefore 2nd quarter figures have come in unfavourably in comparison, as contingency measures such as stockpiling were unwound.

While this is clearly not a positive release it has had minimal impact in the markets, due in part to the lagging nature of the data and also thanks to more recent indicators pointing at a recovery in Q3.

The pound remains not far from its lowest level in 3 weeks after the release with the G rate hovering just above the $1.23 handle. The is also trading little changed on the day, holding firm above the 7400 handle for now.
description: Forex Analysis by XTB (David Cheetham) covering: FTSE 100, BPL/USD. Read XTB (David Cheetham)'s latest article on Investing.com UK.
